span: BEWARE!! "unlocked" becomes locked after return window expires
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2026
a-link-normal: Color: Silver ShadowMemory Storage Capacity: 128 GB
review-text: phone had minor scratches and appeared to have an aftermarket screen replacement but worked fine and seemed unlocked....so i kept it. 4 months later after a routine android software update the phone locks down and reveals that it was still attached to the previous carrier and now i can no longer use it. Apparently this is a common scam where sellers don't properly unlock but instead use hacking software that works just long enough to avoid liability. i'm enraged

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2026
a-link-normal: Color: Silver ShadowMemory Storage Capacity: 128 GB
review-text: When I bought the phone it was unlocked. After a software update from the manufacturer, the phone has become unusable. After taking to both my carrier and Samsung twice it turns out it's now locked to a carrier (Verizon). I spoke with Verizon who stated that the previous owner broke their contract so they won't be unlocking the phone. I contacted the seller who tried to tell me that it is indeed unlocked, but the software update just reverted it back to the old carrier. They sent me instructions that required downloading two different applications on to a PC, then hooking my phone to it and what not. For one thing, I don't own a PC, for another thing, when buying an unlocked phone you shouldn't have to go back in to it to "unlock" it yourself. And, this just seems like a work around. I told the owner that I was told by Samsung, my carrier, and Verizon that this phone is locked to Verizon and he "assured" me this wasn't the case.  I think Verizon would know. Just be weary of buying an "unlocked" phone. It might be temporarily unlocked but a software update could have you left with a phone that's only good as a tiny tablet with no phone capabilities.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2025
review-text: Phone is NOT unlocked, and I cant get anyone to respond back to me about it. This is my first time not going through a carrier to purchase a refurbished phone and I cant even use it. Now I see there are others who purchased this phone and they were still locked. Amazon should do a better job of holding its vendors accountable for false advertisement. This phone was still locked to Mint Mobile, and they refuse to help me aince I dont have an account with them. I use this phone number on Cricket, and they tried to fix it for me, but their hands are tied. Ridiculous how consumers are being taken advantage by corporations, and all the supposed  protections amount to nothing. This is nothing more than theft by corporations.

span: Locked to a network after 40 days.
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2026
a-link-normal: Color: Silver ShadowMemory Storage Capacity: 128 GB
review-text: Phone worked well for 40 days. After that  the phone became locked to a network. I could not call or text. Upon the seller's recommendation I got a physical SIM card.  The phone was still locked. Mint Mobile said the phone was the problem. They indicated that the last owner owed a bill and that's why it was locked. The seller told me it was probably a glitch with Samsung and to watch a YouTube video. Thankfully, Amazon gave me a full refund. Stay away from this seller!!

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2026
review-text: I purchased this phone as a refurbished phone but it does not hold battery charge for even a day I was going to return it but then I would have been stuck with no phone because I had already traded my other phone in and would have taken a gamble on having to try another phone out and there were no more Black Friday specials so now I'm stuck with a phone that I have to charge often I would not recommend this company,they didn't even offer to give me a discount when I told them about the poor battery life

span: not truly unlocked or ready to use with your cellular company
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: Silver ShadowMemory Storage Capacity: 128 GB
review-text: Do not buy from this seller if you are on Verizon. This phone will not be able to used due to their imei. I wasted two weeks trying my best to get things to work but after countless calls and trips to Verizon its was all worthless. This may be an ‚Äúunlocked‚Äù phone but it was not compatible with my carrier Verizon. Dealing with this was one of the worst experiences I have had regarding a cellular device. I think the seller should somehow note that there may be issues getting this thing to work so people don‚Äôt think they‚Äôre getting a good deal. Don‚Äôt waste your time like me.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2026
a-link-normal: Color: Silver ShadowMemory Storage Capacity: 128 GB
review-text: S25 was delivered and in excellent condition. But be careful,  if you purchased the unlocked model, did a phone update and the S25 networked locked to T-Mobile, and we have AT&T. AT&T tech let us know this S25 was not a true unlocked model. AT&T did give us a trade in value more than trying to get refund from this vendor.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2026
review-text: The phone they sold me WAS NOT unlocked. I could not connect to my carrier. Wasted weeks trying while the seller continuously told me that it was unlocked. It was a lie. The phone is NOT unlocked.

span: Seller claims it's "Unlocked" but it's incompatible with travel ESIMS
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2025
a-link-normal: Color: Silver ShadowMemory Storage Capacity: 256 GB
review-text: Sold as unlocked but is incompatible with ESIMs for travel--good luck if you think you've got an UNLOCKED phone and happen to go to any other country. The seller will not help, it's simply not their problem. Verizon can't help, it's up to the buyer to pay for some other workaround. Sucks to land in an international airport and your gear simply won't work because it's been inaccurately advertised; one month of travel later and the return window closed. Here's your review for the buying experience. Hope this won't be as much of a surprise to anyone else as it was to me.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2025
review-text: Had to give at least one star just for a review and that is too much! This phone was locked üò°üò° You pay all this money to get an unlocked phone only for it to be locked and I cannot return it. This is extremely frustrating.
